sources.source_name: Florida Department of State - Division of Corporations
Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Solicitation of Contributions

incorporation_agency: Florida Department of State - Division of Corporations
charitable_registration_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross revenue under $50,000 and receiving contributions from fewer than 100 contributors may be exempt from charitable registration, but must still register and file simplified forms.

formation_requirements.certificate_of_formation: Articles of Incorporation - Florida Not For Profit Corporation
formation_requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of State - Division of Corporations
formation_requirements.notes: Florida requires a registered agent with a physical Florida address. The registered agent can be an individual or a business entity authorized to do business in Florida.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of State - Division of Corporations
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by May 1st each year regardless of incorporation date
required_information: Names and addresses of directors and officers
requirements.notes: Filing fee is $61.25 online, higher for paper filing. Late filing penalty of $400 applies. Failure to file for two consecutive years results in administrative dissolution.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Division of Consumer Services
requirements.form_number: Form CH-410 - Solicitation of Contributions Registration Application
required_information: List of officers and directors with addresses
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Initial registration is free but required before soliciting. Organizations must register even if exempt from annual filing. Registration number must be displayed in solicitations.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end, but no later than 9 months after prior filing
requirements.form_number: Form CH-1500 - Charitable Organization Annual Report
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Organizations with revenue under $50,000 from <100 contributors file simplified CH-1500-EZ. Religious organizations and certain others are exempt from filing but must maintain registration.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form DR-5 - Consumer's Certificate of Exemption
required_information: Florida Annual Resale Certificate for Sales Tax (DR-13) if applicable
requirements.notes: Form DR-5 is provided to vendors to claim exemption from sales tax on qualifying purchases. Not all purchases are exempt - exemption applies to items used in furtherance of charitable purpose. No formal application process; organization self-certifies eligibility.

requirements.requirement_name: Application for Ad Valorem Tax Exemption (Form DR-501)
requirements.due_date_specifics: March 1st each year for exemption beginning January 1st
requirements.form_number: Form DR-501 - Application for Ad Valorem Tax Exemption
required_information: Lease agreements (if property is leased to others)
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable, educational, or religious purposes. Literary and scientific properties also qualify. Exemption must be applied for annually. Rental of property may disqualify exemption.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services - Division of Licensing
requirements.due_date_specifics: File application at least 30 days before raffle event
required_information: Proof of incorporation in Florida (or registration if foreign)
Proposed ticket price and sales numbers
requirements.notes: Florida allows up to 2 raffles per year for qualified nonprofits. Organization must exist for 3+ years. Total prizes cannot exceed $100,000 per year. Tickets must be sold in Florida. Professional operation prohibited.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.form_number: Form CH-420 - Solicitor of Contributions Registration
required_information: List of officers and employees who will solicit
List of current charity clients in Florida
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional fundraisers who solicit on behalf of charities. Each contract with a charity must be filed within 10 days. Bond must be maintained throughout registration period. Paid employees of registered charities are exempt.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.form_number: Form CH-425 - Professional Fundraising Consultant Registration
required_information: List of current charity clients in Florida
requirements.notes: Professional fundraising consultants provide advice but do not solicit or handle contributions. Lower registration fee than solicitors. No bond required. Each contract must be filed within 10 days.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and included in CH-1500 filing if required
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before CH-1500 due date)
requirements.notes: Florida requires audit for organizations with gross revenue over $500,000 OR that pay professional solicitors. Organizations between $200,000-$500,000 must have financial review. Organizations under $200,000 may file internally prepared statements. Audit must be performed by Florida-licensed CPA.

requirements.filing_agency: Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
requirements.due_date_specifics: At least 10 days before event if using professional solicitor
requirements.notes: Required when a for-profit sponsor conducts special event benefiting a charity. Post-event report (CH-1531) must be filed within 90 days. Discloses what percentage actually benefits the charity.

special_notes.solicitation_act: Florida's Solicitation of Contributions Act (Chapter 496) is comprehensive and actively enforced. Registration is required before soliciting, with limited exemptions.
special_notes.registration_number_disclosure: Florida registration number (CH followed by numbers) must be included in all written solicitations and on the organization's website if soliciting online.
special_notes.annual_report_deadline: The state corporate annual report is due May 1st for all nonprofits regardless of incorporation date. This is different from fiscal year-based charitable registration renewal.
special_notes.board_requirements: Florida nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Florida residents. Board must meet regularly and maintain minutes.
special_notes.audit_thresholds: Florida has relatively low audit thresholds: $500,000 in gross revenue OR any amount if using professional solicitors. Many small nonprofits must obtain audits.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying activities. Violations can jeopardize tax-exempt status.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with professional solicitors or consultants must be filed with FDACS within 10 days of execution. Failure to file can result in penalties for both parties.
special_notes.raffle_restrictions: Florida raffle law is restrictive: only 2 per year, 3-year organizational history required, $100,000 annual prize limit, no professional management, tickets sold only in Florida.
special_notes.property_tax_exclusivity: Property tax exemption requires exclusive use for exempt purposes. Any commercial rental or non-exempt use can disqualify the entire property from exemption.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to other 501(c)(3) organizations or government entities. Florida courts must approve dissolution plans.
special_notes.small_org_exemption: Organizations with <$50,000 revenue from <100 contributors file simplified CH-1500-EZ but must still register initially with CH-410.
special_notes.no_state_income_tax: Florida has no state income tax, so no separate state tax exemption application is needed beyond federal 501(c)(3) status.
